intro: Echinocereus scheeri, commonly known as the Snowball Cactus, is a species of cactus native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is characterized by its dense clusters of white, spherical flowers that bloom in late winter to early spring. The plant has cylindrical, ribbed stems that are typically green and covered in white to pale blue spines. It thrives in well-drained soil and requires full sun to partial shade. Due to its striking appearance and unique flowering habit, it is a popular choice for rock gardens and xeriscaping.
